Comment: Tempting black to play g5, but Qh5+, Ng6, Nxg6, NxN, allows the B to retire (note that black has no g6 anymore, that's the key). Very wild game is obtained if black persists in the pin, with Kd7 instead.

Qh5+ is not good while the pawn stays in g7, so I just waited.
Qh5+ is not good while the pawn stays in g7, so I just waited.
Black is cramped, but solid. His only weak spot is e6, but it is not easy for me to attack: Qg4, f5. and the BQ can still escape via b6.
A "just developing" move, with an eye on g6, of course.
Needed. But now...
Here the fork works, since my Q can't go to h5+ anymore. But g5 is not supported anymore, so Bxg5 became possible... until black doesn't play another move.
Relief! Here, I can exchange the N and be out of troubles, but I was looking for some fun, so...
Black will lose the N anyway, and my pieces will be more active... or so I believed!
That was the key! Now, h7 is pinned to the R.

Unfortunately, white is in no position to get inmediate profit of the royal alignement. e6, again, is weak but not easily attackable...
I wanted to get into complications, risking to lose a piece somewhere.

The R is defended, the pin is broken. No more inmediate attacks I can see, so I better retire and play with the pawn. Not a fantastic cash for all this!

Throwing a threat in between. In retrospect, this move is highly suspicious, since Rg8 and my R is not defended...
Not really sure about this move. I just wanted to create pressure, but I confess that my attack was under a "?"

Fortunately, black just doesn't have good moves, and this is to provide Bc8 a place to go, and a defence to e6.
Just developing, with the idea to double rooks, but without seeing the path!
Attacking my R, preventing any c4 idea since the B can't move from the diagonal. I have to look elsewhere, and stick to my plan.

Very well played. The trick is that at some point of the exchange, QxR would have been possible. Here, I missed the simple NxN, and if QxR, Nd6+ winning the Q. I can only say I was in a time trouble (3+5sec blitz).
